comment.author: 8256808@N02
comment._content: This was taken on Broadway and Houston Street--the building on the left with the wide arches is the Cable Building (McKim, Mead & White, 1894). Houston was later widened in part thanks to subway construction, meaning that some of the buildings closest to the photographer are now long gone.

comment.author: 25041079@N04
comment._content: This would be the funeral of Maj. Gen. Frederick Dent Grant, U.S. Army, who died April 12, 1912, while commanding general of the Department of the East with headquarters at Governor's Island in New York Harbor.  General Grant was the son of Ulysses S. Grant.  There is a small collection of Frederick Dent Grant papers at Southern Illinois University, Carbondale, Illinois.
